summary: This document is a Deed of Trust related to a loan secured by a property in Charlotte, North Carolina. It outlines the roles of the Borrower, Lender, and Trustee, as well as the terms of the loan, including payment obligations and escrow requirements. This document outlines the terms and conditions related to a loan agreement, focusing on the responsibilities of the Borrower regarding property insurance, occupancy, maintenance, and the handling of miscellaneous proceeds. It details the obligations of the Borrower to maintain insurance coverage and the rights of the Lender in case of default or property damage. This document appears to be a legal security instrument related to a loan agreement, outlining the obligations of the borrower and lender, including terms regarding liability, notices, and rights in case of default. It includes provisions for the handling of hazardous substances on the property and the process for acceleration of the loan in case of breach of contract.

keyFacts: The document is a Deed of Trust dated December 10, 2014.
The Borrower is a Florida Limited Liability Company.
The Lender is Fifth Third Mortgage Company.
The loan amount is $325,000.00 with a repayment due by January 1, 2030.
The property is located in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina.
The Borrower is required to maintain property insurance against various hazards as stipulated by the Lender.
The Borrower must occupy the property as their principal residence within 60 days of executing the Security Instrument.
If the Borrower fails to maintain insurance, the Lender may obtain coverage at the Borrower's expense.
The document specifies that any insurance proceeds must be applied to the restoration or repair of the property unless deemed economically unfeasible.
The Borrower is in default if they provide materially false information during the loan application process.
The document outlines that the borrower remains liable even if the lender extends payment terms or modifies the loan.
It specifies that co-signers are not personally obligated to pay the sums secured by the security instrument unless they execute the note.
The lender may charge fees for services performed in connection with the borrower's default.
The borrower has the right to reinstate the loan after acceleration under certain conditions.
The document includes provisions regarding hazardous substances and the borrower's obligations related to environmental laws.
